subject: Short and Cryptic
event:
The Giants did not fire Tom Coughlin.  Instead they gave him a one-year extension, to ensure "stability" and prevent him from being a lame duck.

Sigh.  Personally, if "stability" means collapsing after a 5-2 start, as Coughlin's teams have done three years in a row, I vote for unstable.

I hope Tom will at least have the sense to make some staff changes, and the courage to declare an open competition for starting QB next year in training camp.  

On other fronts... there has been some exciting news this week, but I can't talk about it yet.  Do keep an eye on my news page, however.  Big announcement coming soon.

comments.article:
Is it the announcement so many have been waiting for? =P
Ah. Right. No talking, hehe.
Thanks for the hint, though.
George, you're such a tease.
Thank you for telling us. I'll be watching.
Sounds exciting! :)

Congratulations on the exciting news! I look forward to hearing more in the future.

Also, I just recently finished _Feast for Crows_ over the Christmas holiday, and I thought it was fantastic. Thanks again for such a wonderful (if grim) story. Now, of course, I can only sit and wait with bated breath for the next book! ;)
They rehired Coughlin for a year so they can be in the running for Bill Cowher next year. Guaranteed.

Dare I hope it's the news we are all waiting for?
BTW I've just finished The Feast for Crows for the second time, and it has prove me wrong; since I was rather disappointed the first time around.
Lot of love form Croatia. Bahod.

On other fronts... there has been some exciting news this week, but I can't talk about it yet. Do keep an eye on my news page, however. Big announcement coming soon.

You are such a tease, Mr Martin.

I keep thinking that Coughlin might be the right man for the job, but the Giants might not be the team. Whenever the Giants were successful, the past two or three seasons, they seemed to be playing over their heads. I hope things improve. I'm a Pats fan, but a lot of folks in New England have a soft spot for the Giants.
stegoking might be on to something, with the Bill Cowher theory.

I'm looking forward to you big announcement

I belive I speak for all of your internacional readers when I say : To hell with football ! (try watching some soccer...)

Please start writing and do not stop until you finish. (and then start again on the next book)

jon-snow

I am a fan of futbol as well as football, though I do have to say that American football is my first love. Being a fan of military history, it's really easy to apply that knowledge to the game. Trying to predict where the other team is going to be weakest and applying an appropriate amount of pressure to that area. That concept alone makes me believe that General Lee would not have made a good head coach, even though his offensive coordinator got the blame for Day 3 of Gettysburg. If you think I'm kidding, find a book on military history, replace the company markers with X's and O's, and see if it looks familiar.

Besides, even though it's a bit brutish at times, its line up and run a play nature causes it to be the perfect spectator sport.

Exciting news, eh?

Being finished with A Dance with Dragons isn't news, per se, because you'd know about it...so...I'm crossing my fingers for HBO picking up the rights to do a 5-year television series (as they recently did with the comic Preacher).

That would certainly be some killer news, but I highly doubt that's the case. To me, completion oif ADwD IS some pretty damn good news, so I'd be happy with that.

Later
F.G.J.
Will these announcements be made in your blog as well? Going to a website for news is so 2003.

Heh, you poor Giants fans. And no Tiki next year either. For all his distractions, he made up for the rest of the team's deficiencies in the clutch.Not gonna lie, George, I'd be more hopeful about Gang Green than Big Blue next fall, personally.
Not to get all metaphysical, but no Tiki will lower expectations, which, for the past few years, is when the Giants have played their best.

I love/hate the teasing lol

I want to be a Peyton Manning fan and I follow the Giants a little because of him. Maybe a QB competition is what they need. I just wish they could get Tiki Barber to come back next year.

-Will

Tiki is too much of a dissenter. He's always had locker room issues. Don't mistake his gentlemanly demeanor for being a good teammate.

Isn't it telling that none of his teammates seemed sad on the final day?

If Brandon Jacobs stays healthy (big if) the Giants won't miss Tiki. "You can write that down."

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: horns
comments.article: Well there goes my last shreds of focus for the work day. Thanks, George. ;-)

RE: NFCEast Football. Look on the bright side... you could be a fan of the Redskins.

OH how Danny-boy has ruined this once fine team.

Now I'll have to read more Wild Cards to get my mind off of the disappointing sports picture of the DC area. All of our teams suck except for the pro soccer team, but nobody cares about them.
The Ravens suck? Thats news to me, unless you don't consider them part of your area...
I'm not a Giants fan, but I do agree that Coughlin should have been fired. I think he should give Manning another chance, however. I'm looking forward to the exciting news.

Why fire him now and hire a subpar coach when you can wait a year and get Cowher? Maybe he'll right the ship a bit this next year, and since the Giants are relatively close to Pennsylvania he'll look more favorably at an offer from there....
Tease. :)

I doubt it'll be finishing A Dance with Dragons, Mr. Martin said he'd post on his website as soon as it was finished, and he has no reason not to talk about it at the moment.
A TV series would actually be the best thing EVER. I'm trying to think of what else it could be...
I would think a computer game deal or an MMO would be more likely than a TV deal.
Be sure to post your big news here too. :-)

It won't be about the next book. That would be in the Ice and Fire Update section.

This will be about one of the other umpteen projects that always seem to take precedence over actually finishing this series.

If you did the same thing every single day for years and years, wouldn't you want a break? Don't you have other interests? Wouldn't you rather have quality over quantity? It's people like you that cause publishers to push projects before they're ready. Give the guy a break.

I hope that the news is something to do w/ Dragons, but if you look back at his blogs you may notice this little sentence that looks like it might be what he is talking about:

"I've inked a couple of exciting new subrights deals that I expect to be announcing very soon (watch my news page)... and we may be close to a couple of other subrights deals that I won't be announcing, because I am not allowed to talk about 'em yet."

Not really sure what that means, but I don't think it has anything to do with dragons.

Come on, we all know that he's not finished with the Dance. :) Still dancing your long dance mr. Martin? Thought so. Godspeed to you.

You're invited to Croatia. Once you finished the saga, that is. :)

Patrician

Intriguing. I suspect it's going to be one of the following: a new home for the Game of Thrones RPG, a TV deal (an adaption of The Hedge Knight?), final completion of the editing of the next Wild Cards book, completion of the third Dunk & Egg story or a computer game deal, any/all of which would be awesome.

Here's one fan hoping it's good news on the writing front! Any progress is still progress, and progress is a Very Good Thing.

Rock on, Mister Martin, rock on.

I knew they wouldn't fire him. The Maras are wed to him. Add to that Ernie leaving, both fathers and owners dying with the sons taking over and being in their first year of managing the company, and a QB coming into his proving year next year, it just didn't make sense to fire the head coach. If you did that the huge investment made for Manning would have to be written off without the organization doing everything feasible to make him worth it.

Oh, and I prefer you as a man, but whatever floats your boat.
comments.subject: I told you.

comments.article:
I agree the giants should be one of the best teams in the NFL and they fact that they finished 8 and 8 is discraceful in addition Eli Manning deserves to be fired

Lastly i would like to BEG for a fire and Ice update i check your site 3 times a day for an update its like relidgeous and I just meen to ask on behalf of the sanity of your many fans to PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE give us an update

Thanx so much!
comments.subject: I need a fire and ice update
